hero.title: Three Methods Strategy
hero.subtitle: Master trend, range, and reversal trading techniques — identify market conditions, filter noise, and capture high-probability trade setups with precision and confidence.

items.1: Objective: Capture profits by trading with the direction of the trend.
items.3: Buy Signal: Shorter-term MA crosses above longer-term MA (bullish crossover).
items.4: Sell Signal: Shorter-term MA crosses below longer-term MA (bearish crossover).
items.5: Example: 50-day and 200-day Moving Averages — Golden Cross and Death Cross setups.

items.1: Objective: Profit within sideways markets by buying near support and selling near resistance.
items.2: Tools: Bollinger Bands, RSI, support and resistance levels.
items.3: Buy Signal: Price near support or lower Bollinger Band.
items.4: Sell Signal: Price near resistance or upper Bollinger Band.
items.5: Example: Place stop-loss just beyond range boundaries to avoid breakout losses.

items.1: Objective: Capture profits from major trend reversals.
items.2: Tools: Candlestick patterns, divergence indicators, Fibonacci levels.
items.3: Buy Signal: Bullish reversal pattern (e.g., hammer) with bullish divergence.
items.4: Sell Signal: Bearish reversal pattern (e.g., shooting star) with bearish divergence.
items.5: Example: Place stop-loss below the bullish pattern low or above the bearish pattern high.

items.1: Identify Market Conditions: Use ADX and Bollinger Bands to determine if the market is trending or ranging.
items.2: Filter Signals: Confirm trades using secondary indicators to improve accuracy.
items.3: Risk Management: Adjust stop-losses and position sizing based on volatility and market conditions.

items.1: Versatile: Works in trending, ranging, and reversing market conditions.
items.2: Improved Accuracy: Using multiple methods reduces false signals.
items.3: Comprehensive: Balances trend-following, range, and reversal approaches for well-rounded trading.

items.1: Complexity: Requires understanding of multiple trading techniques and indicators.
items.2: High Monitoring: Demands active analysis and regular adjustments.
items.3: Risk of Overtrading: Can lead to excessive trades if not managed with discipline.
